label: AB_hR6_166_ac_bc-001
title: $\epsilon$-Hf$_{3}$N$_{2}$ Structure
comments:
The Hf-N phase diagram has three known phases (Rudy, 1970; Villars, 2023): \begin{itemize} \item HfN, stable up to the melting point of 3387$^\circ$C, is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cF8_225_a_b-001}{NaCl ($B1$)} structure. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_hR6_166_ac_bc-001}{$\epsilon$-Hf$_{3}$N$_{2}$} is stable up to 1970$^\circ$C. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_hR8_166_2c_abc-001}{$\zeta$-Hf$_{4}$N$_{3}$} is stable in the range 1225-2300$^\circ$C. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-0.25in} 
 Only 2/3 of the nitrogen sites are occupied, giving the observed stoichiometry. 
 $\epsilon$-Hf$_{3}$N$_{2}$ is also referred to as $\eta$-Hf$_{3}$N$_{2}$. We use the designation provide by (Rudy, 1970). 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B2C_hR6_166_ac_c_b-001}{Ta$_{2}$VC$_{2}$} is a ternary form of this structure. 
 Hexagonal settings of this structure can be obtained with the option {\tt --hex}.
